text: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Hobbit Tasting. Strange greenish yellow colour with no head. Aroma is rice, some sweet apple, mild earth and herbs. Flavour is rice, earth and some slight alcohol sweetness to it. Finishes quite earthy.

06.11.2014, 0,375l bottle (batch #11) sampled @ BBGTC tasting:
Very light straw colored, completely clear. Aroma is slightly sweet, fermented rice, minerals, boozy alcohol (slightly in the direction of thinner), hay, wood. Taste is slightly sweet fruity, minerals, fermented rice, hay, alcohol, wood, licorice, hints of fruits. Slightly watery mouthfeel, mild warming alcohol. Fair enough.

Bottle, shared with BBGTC. Crystal clear straw yellow body. Aroma is pears, glass noodles, pears, thinner-like alcohol, hints of pepper and wood. Taste is alcohol, rice noodles, hints of aniseed and sweet raisin-like tones. Pretty tasty, but a bit alcoholic somehow.

350 ml green bottle, from the brewery. ABV is 17%. No carbonation. Clear colour, nearly like water, but with a faint greenish-yellowish hue. The aroma is fairly fruity, also notes of alcohol, marzipan, mushrooms and rice. Sweetish and alcoholic flavour, notes of cheap homemade white wine, mushrooms and some fruit. I do no longer expect ever to grasp the Greater Meaning of sake, and this one brought me no closer to enlightenment.

350 ml bottle. Clear, pale straw golden body with no head. The consistence is a bit oily. Mild, subdued complex and really delicate aroma of fruit, especially citric fruit and a hint of something between canned pear and peach. Flavour is delicate as in aroma, relatively strong fruity for sake, acidic like berries, mild gooseberries, mild warming alcohol and a hint of yeast. Fine body and a long, quite refreshing, slightly acidic aftertaste. This is the best sake I have tasted so far. Nice by itself and a perfect match with blue cheese.

Bottle at Stockholm Beer and Whiskey Festival 2012. Clear, grape/green liquid. Aroma of rice, pear, grain, mushrooms and light booze. Taste is dry with notes of rice and mushrooms. Light to medium bodied.
Stockholm Beer & Whiskey 2012: Mycket torr, men ändå frisk och även vinös på en gång. Lätt men kanske lite tunn i eftersmaken.

Sample at SBWF 2012, Master Class with Kjetil Jikiun.

Very clear, almost like water. No head. This one felt "refreshing" with yeast, fruit, almonds and rice. Did not notice any alcohol.
Sample at the brewery from a bottle. Clear colour . Aroma is fruit, rice, alcohol, apple. Flavour is fruit, rice, alcohol, ripe apple. Nice sake.

Sampler at the brewery. Clear straw golden with no head. Aroma of ripe yellow apples, rice and pears. Sweet and vinuous with notes of berries and flowers. Full body. Light astringent mouth feel and a hint at a carbonated feeling on the tongue. Alcoholic warmth in the mouth and down the throat.
From bottle at Bølgen&Moi (Kompromissløs sakeaften, okt. 2011). No color, a bit hazy. No head. Aroma is fruit and some alcohol. Flavor is medium sweet with fruity notes.

Bottle 350ml
Pours hazy almost colorless.
Aroma has notes of rice, fruits, alcohol and almonds.
Taste is medium sweet 
Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat

Bottle. A more or less clear one, some particles suspended in the almost colorless body. Very fruity on the nose, with banana, yellow apples and some apricot. A little alcohol too, but very subdued. Its quite viscous on the palate, a little alchohol burn on the tongue, and that unique almost papery feeling Ive only had in sake I think. It has a flavor that is equally fruity as the aroma, but due to more impact from the alcohol, its not all fruits. Theres a hint of something earthy too, something mushroom like. It lasts for a long time in the mouth, with a pleasant warmth following you for some time. Hmm, seems the Nøgne Ø sakes are getting better and better, at least this ones really nice. 110329
